Headline: Aisha Salaudeen
Article_Body: Aisha Salaudeen is a multimedia journalist and features producer currently based out of the CNN Africa bureau in Lagos, Nigeria. She works with the teams producing sponsored CNN specials such as African Voices Changemakers, Inside Africa, and Market Place Africa to create digital stories after the episodes air on TV. She also writes and edits features on China-Africa relations, business, culture, and technology in Africa.   Throughout her career, she has worked in full time and freelance journalism, using images, videos, and text to report and investigate diverse human interest stories in Africa. Her work has appeared in The Financial Times, Al Jazeera English, Okay Africa, and TRT World where she covered thorny issues like alleged police brutality, sexual abuse and surviving Boko Haram.   Salaudeen holds a master's degree in finance, accounting and management from the Bradford University School of Management, along with a bachelor's degree in business/managerial economics from the University of Bradford.
